sourceMeaningMnemonic: When you see the <radical>spring</radical> <radical>sun</radical> you know it's finally the  <kanji>spring</kanji> season.
meaningInfo: The spring sun only comes out in spring, which is why you know for sure it's spring. Imagine a different looking sun that only comes out in spring but not the other seasons.
readingMnemonic: When the <kanji>spring</kanji> season comes around, it makes you want to laugh: "<reading>HAR</reading> (<ja>はる</ja>) HAR HAR!" you yell.
readingInfo: Go ahead and belt out a few "HAR HAR HARs" for spring. It's warming up, everything is coming to life, and you're happy. "HAR HAR HAR!"
